questions.question: The ………………………… speech went on for over an hour.
questions.description: Grandiloquent means high sounding or pompous.

questions.question: The paintings show the ……………………………. of the royal palace in
The government will ………………………….. land to anyone willing to farm it.
questions.description: To grant is to give. Grand means majestic or impressive.

questions.question: She is not …………………………… enough to be a good hostess.
questions.description: Gracious means affable or courteous. Graceful means lissome or supple.

questions.question: Helping the poor gives her tremendous ……………………………
questions.description: Gratification means satisfaction. Gratitude means thankful.

questions.question: The wet leaves ………………………… towards the bottom of the pool.
questions.description: Gravitate means fall, sink or descend.

questions.question: I am indebted to you for your ……………………………. help.
The candle made only a ……………………… in the vast room
questions.description: A glimmer is a small glow. A glimpse is a brief look.

questions.question: Good winners don’t ………………………….. over their victory.
questions.description: To gloat over something is to revel in it.

questions.question: This bill contains a ………………………….. error in addition.
With some words missing and others misspelled, the message was pure ……………………………
questions.description: Gibberish means senseless writing or meaningless talk.

questions.question: The driver …………………………… for the police car to stop.
